commands.name: git config
commands.description: edit config, save/close file to progress

commands.name: git clone
commands.description: clone a repository into a new directory

commands.name: git checkout
commands.description: switch branches or restore working tree files

commands.name: git commit
commands.description: record changes to the repository

commands.name: git cherry-pick
commands.description: apply changes introduced by some existing commits

commands.name: git restore
commands.description: restore working tree files

commands.name: git remote
commands.description: manage set of tracked repositories

commands.name: git reset
commands.description: reset current HEAD to the specified state

commands.name: git revert
commands.description: revert some existing commits

commands.name: git rm
commands.description: remove files from the working tree and from the index

commands.name: git rebase
commands.description: reapply commits on top of another base tip

commands.name: git reflog
commands.description: manage reflog information

commands.name: git status
commands.description: Displays the state of the working directory and the staging area.

commands.name: git stash
commands.description: Stashes the changes in the working directory and the staging area.

commands.name: git submodule
commands.description: Manages the submodules in the repository.

commands.name: git switch
commands.description: Switches branches or restores the working directory.

commands.name: git show
commands.description: Displays information about a commit or other Git object.

commands.name: git shortlog
commands.description: Summarizes the commit history by author.

commands.name: git show-branch
commands.description: Shows the commit history of the branches in the repository.

commands.name: git update-index
commands.description: Manipulates the index or the staging area.

commands.name: git update-ref
commands.description: Updates the object name stored in a ref safely.

commands.name: git update-server-info
commands.description: Updates the auxiliary info file to help dumb servers discover the repository's HEAD.

commands.name: git upload-archive
commands.description: Creates an archive of the specified commit.

options.name: --global
options.description: Applies the configuration settings to all repositories on the system for the current user.

options.name: --edit
options.description: Opens the global, system, or local Git configuration file in the default text editor.

options.name: --branch <name>
options.description: Specifies a specific branch to clone from the repository.

options.name: --mirror
options.description: Creates a bare repository with all refs from the source repository.

options.name: <branch>
options.description: Switches to the specified branch.

options.name: -m <message>
options.description: Uses the specified `<message>` as the commit message.

options.name: <commit>
options.description: Applies the changes from the specified commit to the current branch.

options.name: <file>
options.description: Specifies the path to the file that you want to restore.

options.name: add <name> <url>
options.description: Add a remote <name> for the repo at <url>.

options.name: <commit>
options.description: Resets the current branch to the specified commit.

options.name: <commit>
options.description: Reverts the changes made in the specified commit.

options.name: <file>
options.description: Specifies the path to the file or directory that you want to remove.

options.name: <branch>
options.description: Rebases the current branch onto the specified branch.

options.name: --all
options.description: Shows all references, not just those in the current repository.

options.name: --short
options.description: Gives the output in the short-format.

options.name: save
options.description: Stashes the changes in the working directory and the staging area.

options.name: add <repository>
options.description: Adds a new submodule to the repository.

options.name: <branch>
options.description: Switches to the specified branch.

options.name: <object>
options.description: Shows the object (commit, tag, tree, etc.) specified by its SHA or other identifier.

options.name: -s
options.description: Only shows the number of commits by each author.

options.name: --all
options.description: Shows all branches in the output.

options.name: --assume-unchanged <file>
options.description: Tells Git to stop checking the working tree files for possible modifications.

options.name: <ref> <newvalue>
options.description: Updates the object name stored in the ref with the new value.

options.name: -f, --force
options.description: Updates the server info even when it does not seem that update is necessary.

options.name: <ref>
options.description: Specifies the commit to upload.

commands.name: Get-Command
commands.description: Gets all commands.

options.name: -Name <name>
options.description: Specifies the name of the command.
